description:
《英乐天天唱》是一档模仿唱歌类节目，目的在于提升大家的英语口语能力。主持人会在每期节目中选取好听的歌曲片段，并给出发音提示和模仿示例。喜欢听音乐的童鞋可要积极参与哦！去沪江部落订阅本节目！

Pitbull(皮普保罗)，1981年1月15日出生于美国佛罗里达，迈阿密。是欧美乐坛当红HipHop,Rap,Reggaeton歌手。被誉为世界先生，人气超高!代表作品《Culo》《Give Me Everything》《On The Floor》

Ke$ha(原名:Kesha Rose Sebert)，美国流行女歌手兼词曲创作者。被誉为"欧美新晋天后"。2005年已踏入业界，负责作词作曲，背景合音，并在一些MV中友情出演过。Ke$ha家里经济状况一直不好，离家开始工作的四年(2005年~2009年)里又无名，只靠着唱合声和当服务生打零工，更是穷得要命，她的艺名"Ke$ha"中包含了货币符号，有部分原因就是在说她需要钱，又因为这个，歌迷们亲切地称她为"钱婆"。2009年凭借单曲《Tik tok》创出一片天地，获得极大成功，在美国单曲榜连续九周冠军，创下女歌手单曲周下载史上最高记录(61万)，且在全球十一国单曲榜夺冠。

It's going down i'm yelling timber
You better move you better dance
Let's make a night you won't remember
I'll be the one you won't forget

I have em like miley cyrus clothes off
Twerkin in their bras and thongs timber
Face down booty up timber
That's the way we like to what whoooa timber

I'm slicker than an oil spill
She's say she won't but i bet she will timber
Swing your partner round and round
End of the night it's goin down
One more shot another round
End of the night it's goin down

Swing your partner round and round
End of the night it's goin down
One more shot another round
End of the night it's goin down

模唱： 

想要得到主持人专业的点评和意见吗？快来节目现场一试身手吧>>

title: 英文歌曲天天唱：Timber

description:
First though, Steve Jobs, the new film by director Danny Boyle with Michael Fassbender as the polonecked Californian who led the drive to make the computer personal and the phone smart for millions of consumers. The screenplay is by Aaron Sorkin who kept the White House walking and talking through the West Wing TV series which he created. For the big screen, his last film was the Social Network about Facebook founder Mark Zuckerberg. So he's familiar with the challenge of depicting real people and the apparently uncinematic concepts of the digital age. His source for much of the material about Steve Jobs in Apple was Walter Isaacson's biography. But Sorkin made a bold dramatic decision to make this not a comprehensive biopic, but a period drama in three acts, focusing on three episodes, tense moments leading up to three crucial product launches in the 80s and 90s when ambitions and conflicts come to the surface, like this challenge to Steve Jobs from the CEO of Apple, John Sculley. The drama comes from exchanges between Jobs and among others, his colleague and confidant Joanna Hoffman played by Kate Winslet and his sometime collaborator Steve Wozniak, Seth Rogen. It makes for a talky, nervy film, especially at the outset. I asked writer Aaron Sorkin for his reasoning behind the unusual structure.

"Before I knew what I wanted to do, I knew what I didn't wanna do, and that was to write a biopic, a straight cradle-to-grave story where we hit on the characters' greatest hits along the way where Steve meets Woz and let's start a company in my garage or make the MAC and here's the iPhone, that kind of thing."
